macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Global Markets Rally as Tariff Fears Ease
items.summary: Indian stock markets opened in green with Nifty 50 up 0.22% and Sensex up 0.03% as global markets recover from tariff and geopolitical concerns. The pharma sector is expected to benefit from government reduction in drug manufacturing application review periods.

items.title: US Stock Market Gains Amid Strong Economic Data
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose to 6,916 points with a 0.05% gain, while the Nasdaq closed up 0.91% at 23,436.02 and the Dow Jones gained 0.60%. US Q3 GDP was revised up to 4.4% annualised, and jobless claims remained resilient at 200,000.

items.title: Market Rotation: Small-Cap Stocks Outperform Large-Cap
items.summary: Capital is shifting strongly toward small and medium-sized stocks while large-cap stocks face selling pressure. The iShares Russell 2000 ETF (IWM) has rallied 7.3% year-to-date, reversing 2025's underperformance.

items.title: Fed Expected to Hold Rates; USD Weakens Despite Strong Data
items.summary: The USD index fell 0.4% despite solid US economic data, with technical indicators pointing to further downside. Markets are pricing in a Fed rate hold at next week's meeting, with focus shifting to PMI surveys and consumer sentiment data.

items.title: Australian Dollar Surges on Stronger-Than-Expected Jobs Data
items.summary: AUD/USD rose 1.2% to 0.6842, its highest since October 2024, after Australia's unemployment rate unexpectedly fell to 4.1%. Money markets are now pricing a 60% probability of an RBA rate hike in February.

items.title: Fertilizer Prices Surge Amid Positive Agricultural Outlook
items.summary: Urea fertilizer and agricultural input prices are showing strong recovery, supporting industry profitability and creating positive momentum for agricultural and banking stocks in emerging markets.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: BitGo Completes First Crypto IPO of 2026 on NYSE
items.summary: BitGo, a major crypto custody provider, has completed its initial public offering on the New York Stock Exchange, marking a significant milestone for the crypto industry's maturity and demonstrating mainstream capital market recognition of compliant custody solutions.

items.title: Coinbase Forms Independent Advisory Board to Address Quantum Computing Risks
items.summary: Coinbase has established an independent advisory board featuring leading quantum computing and cryptography researchers to assess how quantum computing advances could threaten blockchain security and develop post-quantum resilience strategies.

items.title: Bitcoin Posts Marginal Gains Amid Market Uncertainty
items.summary: Bitcoin gained 0.12% as macro uncertainty recedes and the cryptocurrency moves in lockstep with Nasdaq futures, though market sentiment remains in the 'extreme fear' zone with altcoins broadly weak.

items.title: ELSA Token Surges 35% Following Upbit Listing
items.summary: ELSA experienced a 35% daily surge after being listed on Upbit in KRW, BTC, and USDT trading pairs, becoming one of the day's trending tokens.

items.title: RIVER Token Rises 30% on Short Squeeze
items.summary: RIVER token climbed 30% driven by a short squeeze, with negative funding rates persisting for three consecutive days and the 24-hour average funding rate reaching as low as -1.8%.

items.title: SKR (Seeker) Market Cap Briefly Exceeds $500 Million
items.summary: SKR's market capitalization briefly surpassed $500 million following multiple mentions by the Solana founder and continued listings on additional exchanges.

items.title: Gold Reaches New All-Time High Above $4,950
items.summary: Gold prices broke above USD 4,950, extending to new all-time highs, reflecting broader macroeconomic trends affecting crypto and traditional asset markets.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: UCSB Hosts Inaugural Agentic AI Summit
items.summary: UC Santa Barbara's Center for Responsible Machine Learning is hosting the inaugural CRML Agentic AI Summit, bringing together leading researchers and industry innovators to examine autonomous AI systems capable of planning, reasoning, and acting independently toward complex goals.

items.title: AI Tool Automatically Detects Cognitive Decline Risk in Patient Records
items.summary: Researchers at Mass General Brigham developed an AI agent-based system that automatically scans clinical notes to identify patients at risk of cognitive decline, matching or exceeding the performance of human-designed queries.

items.title: Alibaba Cloud Expands AI Partner Ecosystem with 10x Investment Increase
items.summary: Alibaba Cloud announced a major expansion of its global partner strategy for 2026, increasing investment in AI incentives tenfold and launching new capability-building initiatives for channel, ISV, and service partners.

items.title: ZenaTech Advances Quantum Computing Prototype for AI Applications
items.summary: ZenaTech provided a progress update on its proprietary quantum computing hardware platform, with a five-qubit prototype expected to be operational in late 2026 to support AI-driven defense and government applications.

items.title: Mila and Inovia Capital Launch $100M Venture Scientist Fund for Canadian AI Startups
items.summary: AI research institute Mila partnered with Inovia Capital to create an early-stage venture capital fund targeting approximately 55 AI-focused companies from Canadian academic institutions.

items.title: Linux Foundation Expands 2026 Events Program Focused on Open Source AI
items.summary: The Linux Foundation unveiled its 2026 global events program with emphasis on open source AI, agentic systems, and scalable AI infrastructure.

items.title: AI Accelerates Clinical Trial Operations Through Automation
items.summary: Industry experts highlight how AI can streamline clinical trial processes by automating administrative tasks, identifying suitable sites, and analyzing historical trial data to accelerate drug development.

items.title: New Generative AI Method Accelerates Drug Discovery
items.summary: Researchers developed a new AI-driven technique that could significantly speed up the discovery of drugs and advanced materials by enabling scientists to design chemical compounds more efficiently.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Highguard On Track for January 26 Release Despite Marketing Silence
items.summary: Wildlight Entertainment's free-to-play hero shooter Highguard is confirmed for its January 26 launch across PlayStation 5, PC, and Xbox Series X/S, with recent Steam activity showing active development despite weeks of community speculation.

items.title: Ubisoft Stock Crashes 34% Following Cancellation of 6 Games and €1 Billion Loss
items.summary: Ubisoft announced a major restructuring that cancels six games including a Prince of Persia: Sands of Time remake, closes studios in Halifax and Stockholm, and forecasts a €1 billion operating loss for fiscal 2026.

items.title: Black Desert Applies Server Stability Update
items.summary: Black Desert released an update on January 23, 2026 to fix server instability issues that occurred following maintenance on January 22.

items.title: Defeating Games for Charity Returns for Third Annual Marathon
items.summary: The Defeating Games for Charity video game marathon returns this weekend (January 23-25, 2026) on Twitch to raise funds for the Video Game History Foundation.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tesla Launches Robotaxi Rides Without Safety Monitors in Austin
items.summary: Tesla began limited robotaxi rides without safety monitors in Austin, marking a symbolic autonomy milestone years behind CEO Elon Musk's 2020 target. The deployment involves only a few vehicles, significantly fewer than competitors like Waymo.

items.title: Japanese Automakers to Share Chip Data via Blockchain System
items.summary: Toyota and other Japanese automakers will share detailed semiconductor data through a secure, blockchain-based system led by JAMA to improve supply-chain resilience following recent shortages and geopolitical concerns.

items.title: Auto Industry Expands Open-Source Software Pact
items.summary: More than 30 automakers, suppliers, and chipmakers joined an expanded VDA-led open-source software initiative targeting up to 40% cost savings and 30% faster time-to-market for vehicle software and AI development.

items.title: ZenaTech Advances Quantum Computing Prototype Development
items.summary: ZenaTech announced progress on its proprietary quantum computing hardware platform, with a five-qubit prototype expected to be operational in late 2026 for defense, homeland security, and government applications.

items.title: Google Workspace for Education Adds Ransomware Detection
items.summary: Google Workspace for Education introduced new ransomware detection and synthetic-content checking capabilities to enhance security for educational institutions.
